body_html:
Ok, I had a minute to debug this. It turns out that the \left and \right don't seem to make any visual difference in Katex, and also they are expressed "\left." "\right.", with a period.

So I did this:

.. math::
    D_{out} = 
    \lfloor
    \frac
    {D_{in} + 2 * {padding}[0] - {dilation}[0] 
      * ({kernel\_size}[0] - 1) - 1} 
    {{stride}[0]} + 1
    \rfloor

(notice also the underscore in kernel_size needs to be escaped now...)

Which renders:

VS. the original:

What do you think? Is this a suitable replacement? The floor delimiters are a bit smaller, but I think this conveys the same meaning.

In any case, it is going to be a bit of work to debug and proof these equations, both for existing content, and new content that may have been produced with MathJax. I don't mind going through these and fixing, but I want to make sure everyone involved is OK with the transition.
